contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox mountain | name = Garnedd Ugain | photo = Garnedd_ugain.jpg | photo_caption = Garnedd Ugain (right) and [[Snowdon]] (left) | elevation_m = 1,065 | elevation_ref = | prominence_m = 72 | prominence_ref = | parent_peak = [[Snowdon]] | listing = [[Hewitt (hill)|Hewitt]], [[Welsh 3000s]], [[Nuttall (hill)|Nuttall]] | translation = Cairn of the Twenty | language = [[Welsh language|Welsh]] | pronunciation = {{IPA-cy|ˈɡarnɛð ˈɨɡain|lang}} | location = [[Gwynedd]], {{WAL}} | range = [[Snowdonia]] | grid_ref_UK = SH610551 | topo = [[Ordnance Survey|OS]] ''Landranger'' 115 }} {{GB summits start}} {{GB summits entry |Name=[[Llechog]] |Height=718 m (2,356 ft) |Status=sub [[Hewitt (hill)|Hewitt]], [[Nuttall (hill)|Nuttall]]}} {{end}} '''Garnedd Ugain''', sometimes referred to as "Crib-y-Ddysgl", is a [[mountain]] in [[Wales]] that forms part of the [[Snowdon Horseshoe]]. It is the second highest peak in Wales, and lies just under one kilometre north of [[Snowdon]] itself. Both ''Garnedd Ugain'' and ''Crib-y-Ddysgl'' appear on the [[Ordnance Survey]]'s maps of the area. The name Crib-y-Ddysgl refers to the east ridge <ref>{{cite book |title=Scrambles in Snowdonia |author = Steve Ashton |publisher=Cicerone Press |year=1992 |isbn=1-85284-088-9}}</ref> whilst the summit is Garnedd or '''Carnedd Ugain'''. Crib-y-Ddysgl (meaning "[[ridge]] of the [[dishware|dish]]" in [[Welsh language|Welsh]]) is the name used by Alan Dawson for the peak's listing as a [[Hewitt (hill)|Hewitt]]. ''Carnedd Ugain'' in Welsh means "Cairn of the Twenty" (the form ''Garnedd'' is the result of [[soft mutation]]). This was named after the [[Segontium Roman Fort|Roman legion based in Caernarfon]]. The web pages of the Welsh Mountaineering Club suggest that the name could also be a corruption of "Carnedd Wgon", and so named after the prince Wgon sung of by [[Dafydd ap Gwilym]] or possibly after the 13th-century poet [[Gwgon Brydydd]].<ref>See [http://www.clwbmynyddacymru.com/Mynyddiadur/Cymru/CarneddUgain/CarneddUgain.htm]. (NB "Gwgon" becomes "Wgon" under soft mutation.)</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Welsh3000}} {{coord|53.07499|-4.07633|type:landmark_region:GB_source:enwiki-osgb36(SH610551)|display=title}} [[Category:Hewitts of Wales]] [[Category:Tourism in Gwynedd]] [[Category:Mountains and hills of Snowdonia]] [[Category:Nuttalls]] [[Category:Furths]] [[Category:Mountains and hills of Gwynedd]] [[Category:Beddgelert]] [[Category:Betws Garmon]] [[Category:Llanberis]] {{Gwynedd-geo-stub}}
